enigma_edit.lua

Class CodeData

  • java.lang.Object
    • enigma_edit.lua.CodeData

  • public class CodeData
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the state of a lua program. Furthermore for each identifier there is info about the origin of its current value as well as the distinction between the different code paths taken for different Enigma Level difficulties.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CodeData()
      Constructor, that initializes this instance with common values.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CodeData

        public CodeData()
        Constructor, that initializes this instance with common values. A table wo and the difficulty constants difficult and wo["IsDifficult"] (of type SimpleValue wrapping a lua boolean) are created. API constants are set (see Constants.initialize(CodeData)). The tile repository resolver ti is created (single instance of Tiles) and a table res is populated with the constructors for the resolvers Composer and Autotile.

        TODO: Add more resolvers.

      • setWorld

        public void setWorld(Resolver resolver,
                     Source defaultkey,
                     Source width,
                     Source height,
                     Mode mode,
                     CodeSnippet code)
        Setup the world call for an empty level. Represents the call wo(resolver, defaultkey, width, height).
        Parameters:
        resolver - Resolver instance (already checked by the CodeAnalyser).
        defaultkey - Default tile key (should be a string).
        width - Width of the new world (should be an integer).
        height - Height of the new world (should be an integer).
        mode - Mode that wo was called in.
        code - Code snippet containing the call.

      • setWorld

        public void setWorld(Resolver resolver,
                     Source defaultkey,
                     Source map,
                     Mode mode,
                     CodeSnippet code)
        Setup the world call for a mapped level. Represents the call wo(resolver, defaultkey, map).
        Parameters:
        resolver - Resolver instance (already checked by the CodeAnalyser).
        defaultkey - Default tile key (should be a string).
        map - World map (should be a table of strings).
        mode - Mode that wo was called in.
        code - Code snippet containing the call.

      • setWorld

        public void setWorld(Resolver resolver,
                     Source libmap,
                     Mode mode,
                     CodeSnippet code)
        Setup the world call for a level created by libmap. Represents the call wo(resolver, libmap).
        Parameters:
        resolver - Resolver instance (already checked by the CodeAnalyser).
        libmap - World map (should be an instance of LibmapMap).
        mode - Mode that wo was called in.
        code - Code snippet containing the call.

      • getWorldCall

        public WoCall getWorldCall(Mode2 mode)
        Return the world call data.
        Returns:
        The world call data as set by any of the setWorld methods.

      • hasWorld

        public boolean hasWorld(Mode mode)
        Check if there is any world call.
        Returns:
        true, if the world had been set by any of the setWorld methods.

        public void dump()
        Dump all data to System.out.
